column4: With the LiveCD can I install without the first starting the liveCD?  I'm trying to get xubuntu on an older machine.. And I'm losing patience waiting for the cd to load.  Plus there isn't much mem, so the GUI is insanely slow.
there's an alternative cd that (i'm pretty sure" has a non0gui install
which version of windows>?
on win98, right click on "my Computer" - and then go to properties
mem is show there
I've used DSL on an old laptop of mine - 120mhz with 32mb ram - runs great
that would probably workl
or flux
try flux before you go back to win98
flux?
fluxbox'
sweet
I can't seem to find a file manager thought.. What do you use?  Just CLI?
that's all i use - there mightg be one for flux but I don't know what it is
there is a #fluxbox channel - they would know
Well I got natulis to launch, but couldn't seem to find my way back.. restarted x
i think un_operateur knows of a good file manager for flux
you could try "rox" in the terminal
didn't get anything in term for rox
ok - un_operateur says it needs to be installed
me neither - what browser?
you're going to hate my answer  my guess is the folks on #fluxbox will know...  :)
